agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides awareness and education to the residents of Fulton County regarding resources.
service_description: Provides free, phone-based information and referral services to link people in Fulton County with the human services they need.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Fulton County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Fulton County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 9am and 3rd Mon 6pm
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 9am and 3rd Mon 6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services and social activities to those who are recovering from substance use, mental health, or anything.
service_description: Provides recovery group that is designed to prevent relapse by increasing social connectedness, providing positive modeling behaviors, encouraging honest feedback, and increasing emotional support.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Walk in during designated times. -- Visit website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Individuals who are drug and alcohol-free for a minimum of 24 hours before coming to the cafe -- Participate in activities at the cafe -- Practice principles of Recovery Cafe community

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and frozen meat to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Complete application on first visit.
site_eligibility: Living in Union, Wayne or Aubbeenaubbee Township

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in Fulton County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market will accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Fulton County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Fulton County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Fulton County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction, non-fiction, reference library materials, music, movies, and various apps and services, to patrons of all ages.
site_name: FULTON COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - FULTON BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) -- For a resident library card: Living in Aubbeenaubbe, Liberty, New Castle, Richland, Rochester, and Wayne Township of Fulton County.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction, non-fiction, reference library materials, music, movies, and various apps and services, to patrons of all ages.
site_name: FULTON COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - ROCHESTER BRANCH
service_name: TECH TIME WITH ZAK - ROCHESTER BRANCH
service_description: Offers free one-on-one tech help, for computers, phones, and any other technology problems.
site_details: Call to verify availability or to schedule a private session.
site_eligibility: Living in Aubbeenaubbe, Liberty, New Castle, Richland, Rochester, and Wayne Township of Fulton County -- 18 or older

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction, non-fiction, reference library materials, music, movies, and various apps and services, to patrons of all ages.
site_name: FULTON COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - AUBBEE BRANCH
service_name: TECH TIME WITH ZAK - AUBBEE BRANCH
service_description: Offers free one-on-one tech help, for computers, phones, and any other technology problems.
site_details: Call to verify availability or to schedule a private session.
site_eligibility: Living in Aubbeenaubbe, Liberty, New Castle, Richland, Rochester, and Wayne Township of Fulton County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides financial assistance to people in need. Assistance may be provided for, but not limited to, rent, mortgage, utility bills, and emergency transportation needs.
site_details: Walk in; first come, first served.
site_eligibility: Limit one visit every 12 months -- Bill that you need assistance with must be current and match name on your ID

agency_desc: A member corporation that provides electric service for rural customers.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Fulton County and portions of Cass, Marshall, Miami, and Pulaski counties.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach services.
service_description: Offers a faith-based, 12-Step program to persons seeking peer support for addiction. Support topics include chemical addictions, abuse, over and under eating, depression, sexual addictions, codependency, anger, and more. After group lesson, smaller, gender-specific groups are formed for further discussion.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Dinner before Group: Tues 5pm -- Celebrate Recovery Lesson and Praise: Tues 6pm; small groups 7pm-8pm
Dinner before Group: Tues 5pm -- Celebrate Recovery Lesson and Praise: Tues 6pm; small groups 7pm-8pm
Dinner before Group: Tues 5pm -- Celebrate Recovery Lesson and Praise: Tues 6pm; small groups 7pm-8pm
Dinner before Group: Tues 5pm -- Celebrate Recovery Lesson and Praise: Tues 6pm; small groups 7pm-8pm
Office: Mon-Thurs 11am-3pm -- Call to arrange a time for selection
Office: Mon-Thurs 11am-3pm -- Call to arrange a time for selection
Office: Mon-Thurs 11am-3pm -- Call to arrange a time for selection
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Fulton County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Fulton County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Fulton County)

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAM
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Five), providing services to seniors in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_name: AREA FIVE CONGREGATE MEAL - ROCHESTER SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for area seniors. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance. A donation is requested.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a community meal, clothing pantry, and hygiene pantry.
service_description: Provides a weekly meal to those in need. Carry-out is available. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in to Fellowship Hall.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A collection of services offered by Fulton County government offices.
service_description: Offers weather alert radios to Fulton County persons in need, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Call for availability and to make a request.
site_eligibility: Living in Fulton County

agency_desc: A collection of services offered by Fulton County government offices.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A collection of services offered by Fulton County government offices.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Fulton County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Fulton County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Fulton County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Matches individuals and groups with volunteer opportunities at nonprofit agencies in Fulton County.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open to individuals and groups; specific volunteer options may have restrictions

agency_desc: A community center for local area seniors offering social activities, along with reserved transportation services.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from Woodlawn Hospital. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Received medically necessary health care services from Woodlawn Hospital (or guarantor of someone who received such services)

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Rochester.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Rochester in Fulton County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Fulton County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF FULTON COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF FULTON COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Fulton County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to speak with the President to request an application or volunteer information. -- Applications may be downloaded and printed from the website.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-80% of area median (Call or see website for current amounts.) -- Stable employment or other source of income (such as SSI or child support) for past 2 years -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Fulton County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Fulton County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_name: UNITED WE STAND MINISTRIES OF AKRON
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and financial assistance.
site_name: UNITED WE STAND MINISTRIES OF AKRON
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Clients make their own selections. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Newcastle or Henry Township -- Limit one visit every 30 days.

agency_name: UNITED WE STAND MINISTRIES OF AKRON
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and financial assistance.
site_name: UNITED WE STAND MINISTRIES OF AKRON - TOWN HALL
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance with rent, utilities, and prescription re-fills. Funds generally do not exceed $250. Applications are accepted once per year per household. Applications are available at the town hall. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in and request an application.
site_eligibility: Living in Newcastle or Henry Township -- Limit assistance to once every 12 months

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization with a charitable food pantry, emergency relief fund and holiday assistance.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Fulton County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Rochester in Fulton County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding city government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_schedule: City Hall: Mon-Fri 7am-3:30pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Rochester

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides street,and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, and street-sign maintenance. Responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property and provides groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Rochester in Fulton County.
site_details: Call for information, or to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Rochester

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides various funding opportunities for residents through various endowments and funds.
service_description: Provides grants to charitable projects for partnering human service agencies.  Scholarships may be available for area students.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information. -- (Persons seeking assistance from one of the programs funded are directed to call 2-1-1.)
site_eligibility: Provides financial support to area non-profits that support community needs.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Fulton County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.www.in.gov/dcs/support.htm
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-5pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides free quality integrated health care for the uninsured of Fulton County and surrounding areas.
service_description: Provides free comprehensive health care, mental health care services provided by doctoral students, and referrals to medically necessary dental and vision services to eligible residents of Fulton County.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Fulton County -- Age 18-64 --Uninsured -- Income at or below 250% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases in Fulton County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the Superior Court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court
